blocks.question: Qui a découvert la structure de l'ADN ?
blocks.explanation: Rosalind Franklin est une physicochimiste britannique, née le 25 juillet 1920 à Notting Hill et morte le 16 avril 1958 à Chelsea. Pionnière de la biologie moléculaire, elle formule la première, dans un rapport non publié, la structure hélicoïdale de l'acide désoxyribonucléique (ADN), découverte spoliée par Watson et Crick qui accèdent à son travail. Elle joue également un rôle majeur dans la découverte du virus de la mosaïque du tabac.

content.title: Improve Your Leadership Skills by Setting Specific Goals
content.content:
At the end of the day, leadership seems like an empty word.
What if you could put in place a super simple formula to improve your soft skills? Tempting? Take these three steps to get closer.
# 1. Where are you now?
Before you start making a list of things you want to change, think. As a help, answer these:
- What would you like to start for a long time, but haven’t started yet?
- What have you been doing lately? What don’t you like?
- What do you find interesting to work on?
- What have you struggled with?
- What feedback did you get?
 **The process of improvement will be easier if you see a clear purpose or advantage.**
# 2. Where do you want to be?
Now, imagine yourself when you break a bad habit or learn a new skill. How do you feel? Proud, happy, contented, accomplished, ready for the next challenge?

Picture yourself in the future. Visualization is powerful. You are likely to really start the improvement process if you see yourself somewhere else than you are now.
Trying to achieve something alone means you need a lot of self-determination. So, it is a good idea to involve someone to hold you accountable and give you a gentle push in the right direction when needed.
**The goal of this step is to decide to begin a process of self-development and to envision yourself in the future.**
# 3. Make a pledge
Don’t dream. Make it a reality. We often have a lot of ideas about what we could do. But we don’t have time, determination, energy, or an idea of where to start.

That is when the pledge comes into play.
You will hardly achieve anything if you don’t break your vision into achievable goals. You don’t want vague corporate gibberish. This is life. Skills are to be put to use, not just on paper.
**Things like these won’t work:**
- I want to be a better listener.
- I will talk to my team more often.
- I will start delegating more fairly.
- I want to become more organized at work.
What do you mean by these? They are nice-to-have statements. But hardly achievable since you don’t know what to do.
Try this simple formula from [James Clear coming from Atomic habits](https://jamesclear.com/atomic-habits) instead:
> “I will (BEHAVIOR) at (TIME) in (LOCATION).”

Make this pledge to yourself. [By articulating it in detail, you are more likely to succeed](https://ivonahirschi.substack.com/p/how-to-build-good-habits-in-2-steps).**_ _**You can do something like this:
- **Be a better listener:** _I will stop playing with my phone during a weekly online meeting with XX (employee) every Thursday when I work from home._
- **Talk to the team more**: _I will schedule a regular 1–1 meeting with each team member every Tuesday and Wednesday when we are in the office._
- **Delegate more fairly**: I will help my team to share their project work by having a capacity stand-up every Monday at work.
- **Be organized**: I will put my cup back in the kitchen after my day is over.
What you notice is that these goals do not point out when you should achieve these improvements. They’d rather **focus on repetition**.
By repeating a behavior, you build a habit. Leadership is a set of good habits. Keep this long-term perspective in mind when setting your goals.
**The goal of this step is to make a specific pledge that focuses on repetition**

content.title: Réchauffement climatique: le rôle de la vapeur d'eau
content.content:
Précipitation terrestre moyenne = 1m sur toute la surface terrestre

Vapeur d'eau = gaz à effet de serre mais retombe sous la forme de pluie (contrairement au méthane +CO2)
